body_html: Yeah, slim will not invoke init_op, but I found the parameter local_init_op is done before saver.restore. Thus, I use local_init_op=tf.global_variables_initializer() and pass it into slim.learning.train(). Is this a proper way? Thank you.
body_text: Yeah, slim will not invoke init_op, but I found the parameter  local_init_op is done before saver.restore. Thus, I use local_init_op=tf.global_variables_initializer() and pass it into slim.learning.train(). Is this a proper way? Thank you.
body: Yeah, slim will not invoke init_op, but I found the parameter  `local_init_op` is done before `saver.restore`. Thus, I use `local_init_op=tf.global_variables_initializer()` and pass it into `slim.learning.train()`. Is this a proper way? Thank you.
